TunableTuple.name: BED_TAGS
TunableTuple.description: Tags to check on an object to determine what type of bed an object is.

TunableList.name: beds
TunableList.description: Tags that consider an object as a bed other than double beds.

TunableList.name: double_beds
TunableList.description: Tags that consider an object as a double bed

TunableList.name: kid_beds
TunableList.description: Tags that consider an object as a kid bed

Tunable.name: FIREMETER_DISPOSABLE_OBJECT_CAP
Tunable.description: Number of disposable objects a lot can have at any given moment.

TunableTuple.name: GLOBAL_SPAWN_FIREMETER
TunableTuple.description: This firemeter is to control the amount of objects can be spawned (usually spawned by system). For example we can tag SP18 Specters as Func_SystemSpawned_Haunted so we can limit the number using Object Spawn Firemeter Test when it's spawned by system.

Tunable.name: tag_weight
Tunable.description: The weight assigned to this tag, say if we have 3 objects having weights 2,3,4, and the first two passed tests, and we have overall_quota 50, then the quota of first two tags will be 20 and 30

TdescFragTag.name: tests_to_opt_in
TdescFragTag.description: These tests need to pass for the tag to be opted in for weight calculation. If tests fail, quota for this tag will be 0.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: This is the tag of system spawned objects, we should make sure they have the prefix 'Func_SystemSpawned'.

Tunable.name: overall_quota
Tunable.description: This is the total number of all system spawned objects we need to enforce in our game at any point.

TunableEnum.description: List of tags to apply to every household inventory proxy object.
Objects with these tags should not exist without a parent. An obvious case is for transient objects. They should only exist as a carried object, thus parented to a sim, when loading into a save game.
